title: UK inflation falls to 1.6%; surge in US house building - business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: us consumer prices rise 0.1 % in july .
euro hits nine-month low against the us dollar .
rpi dips to 2.5 % - rail fares will be affected .
uk inflation falls to 1.6 % in july .

documents.title: european markets end higher again
text: with hopes that tensions between russia and ukraine could be easing , leading shares have recorded another day of gains .
the ftse 100 has hit a three week high - details in nick fletcher 's closing market report - while european markets have also moved higher , as have us shares .

inflation data from the uk and us suggested there was not likely to be an imminent rise in interest rates although stronger than expected us housing starts muddied the and there could be further volatility with bank of england minutes on wednesday and speeches from federal reserve chair janet yellen and ecb boss mario draghi at the jackson hole get-together on friday .

meanwhile the closing stock market scores were : the ftse 100 finished 38.06 points or 0.56 % higher at 6779.31 germany 's dax rose 0.96 % to 9334.28 france 's cac climbed 0.56 % to 4254.45 italy 's ftse mib edged up 0.02 % to 19,644.37 spain 's ibex ended 0.32 % better at 10,386.5 in the us , the dow jones industrial average is currently 70 points or 0.42 % higher .
and on that note , it 's time to close up for the evening .
thanks for your comments and we 'll be back tomorrow .

documents.title: carillion sweetens its offer for balfour beatty
text: back in the city , an ongoing takeover battle has just taken another twist .
construction company carillion announced that its raised its offer for rival balfour beatty .
it 's now offering a 36 % premium to balfour 's share price in late july , before merger plans were made public .
carillion said it had made the new offer following discussions with balfour beatty 's major shareholders '' , which piles more pressure on balfour 's management to return to the negotiating table .
for talks to take place , though , balfour would have to ask the takeover panel to extend its 'put up or shut up ' deadline , of this thursday .

the clock is ticking bloomberg tv ( @ bloombergtv ) breaking : carillion raises balfour beatty offer , values co. at 2.09b pounds andrew trotman ( @ teletrotman ) # carillion chairman : `` board of carillion remains committed to moving forward in a constructive and collaborative way with # balfour '' timesbusiness ( @ timesbusiness ) carillion has just improved its offer for balfour beatty .
now offering 58.268 % share for balfour beatty shareholders ( up from 56.5 % ) .

documents.title: elizabeth arden posts biggest loss ever
text: taylor swift .
strauss/invision/ap in other news , elizabeth arden 's new celebrity perfumes have failed to wow the public .
the cosmetics chain reported its biggest fall in profits ever , after quarterly sales tumbled by over 28 % .

elizabeth arden , which sells celebrity perfumes from the likes of justin bieber and taylor swift , also warned that weak sales would continue for the next six months shares have tumbled by 25 % today - not the sweet smell of success that investors were looking for .

the guardian ( @ guardian ) justin bieber and taylor swift leave scent of failure at perfume giant business insider ( @ businessinsider ) fragrance maker 's stock is crashing because no one wants to smell like justin bieber

documents.title: wall street up
text: america 's stock market has opened in positive territory , after the latest us inflation data showed little signs of inflationary pressures building .
traders also showed relief that there 's been no further escalation in tensions between russia and ukraine .
the nasdaq index , heavy with tech stocks , hit a new 14-year high in early trading , while the dow jones is up 0.25 % .
giovanny moreano ( @ giovannymoreano ) nasdaq composite opens at a 14-year high for the 2nd consecutive day .
| $ qqq @ twitterid most european markets are also holding their earlier gains , led by the german dax , up around 1 % .
european stock markets , afternoon of august 19th 2014 photograph : /thomson reuters

back on this side of the atlantic , a judge has sharply criticised the bank of scotland for double-charging mortgage holders in northern ireland who were behind in their payments henry mcdonald , ireland correspondent , reports : in a judgement released in belfast today judge master ellison accused the bank of unfair accounting over double billing some of its customers for mortgages .
he said : there may not be any fraud involved , but i would certainly not regard this as fair accounting . ''
the judge excoriated the bank and its offshoots , including halifax , after three northern ireland customers took cases against it .
such practices to punish late payments on mortgages had plunged into depression '' many home owners in distress .
overall the bank 's behaviour had been unconscionable '' , the judge concluded .
the housing rights service ( hrs ) in northern ireland took up the cases on behalf of three mortgage holders .
it said if the bank 's practice had gone unchallenged , many borrowers would have lost their homes .
one of the people whom the hrs acted for was a female bank worker who fell behind on her mortgage because she had to leave her home as she was being targeted by criminals .
in addition her partner tied while she was out of house .
as a result she fell behind on her mortgage payments and was later forced to make monthly payments above the original contracted amount for more than one year .

christopher mcgrath , a lawyer acting for hrs , said : the court has stated that the handling of accounts by bank of scotland in these instances , created 'a mist of incomprehension , confusion and self -contradiction ' .
it is our view that this practice unfettered would undoubtedly have resulted in many borrowers unnecessarily losing their home . ''
a lloyds banking group spokesperson said the bank was considering the judgement and will respond accordingly '' when it has fully reviewed the findings .
it owns bank of scotland-halifax , which is a major bank for home owners in northern ireland .
the spokesperson added that the bank encourages customers to contact them at the earliest opportunity if they believe that they will be unable to make their monthly mortgage payment .

documents.title: euro hits nine-month low against the us dollar
text: the surge in the us housing sector has pushed the dollar up against other major currencies .
this sent the euro sliding to a nine-month low of $ 1.3318 .
that could be quietly welcomed in the european central bank , as the euro 's strength has been one factor pushing down eurozone inflation ( to just 0.4 % ) .

documents.title: never mind inflation , look at those housing starts !
text: a 36 floor high rise condominium under construction in miami .
diaz/ap america has also seen a surge in new house-building projects , in a sign that the economy up last month .
housing starts ( the number of new home building projects ) jumped by 15 % in july to an annual rate of 1.093m .
up from 945,000 in june .
and the number of new permits being granted to home-builders also rose sharply , to an annual rate of 1.052m , from 973k .
demand for new multi-occupancy units ( think apartments ) led the revival .
conor sen ( @ conorsen ) big jump in building permits driven by multi-fam noise again - single fam up slightly from 634k to 640k .

documents.title: us consumer prices rise 0.1 % in july
text: america 's inflation crept up a little last month , as higher food and rent costs were countered by a drop in energy costs .
consumer prices rose by 0.1 % in july , the smallest rise in five months .
the annual cpi index was 2.0 % higher than a year ago .
that 's down on june 's 2.1 % .
food prices jumped by 0.4 % during the month , while housing costs rose by 0.2 % .
energy costs , though , fell by 0.3 % , as did the price of gasoline at the pumps , reflecting the recent drop in the oil price .
core cpi , stripping out food and energy , was unchanged at +0.1 % month-on-month .
that 's a weaker rise than economists had predicted .
at first glance , there 's little sign of inflationary pressures that would force the federal reserve into changing its view of the us economy , and the likely pace of rate rises .
i 'll pull together some reaction now bloomberg news ( @ bloombergnews ) the cost of living in america climbed in july at the slowest pace in five months :
one down , one to go we 're about to get the us inflation date for july .
economists predict that the consumer price index could come in at 2.0 % , down from 2.1 % in june .
business insider 's preview explains : expectations are for cpi to rise 0.1 % month-over-month , and 2 % year-over-year .
core '' cpi , which excludes food and gas joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) cpi out in 10 minutes .
core cpi expected to rise 0.2 % mom

documents.title: uk inflation a summary
text: uk inflation over the last decade photograph : /ons recap time , before the latest us inflation data hits the wires .
the uk inflation rate has fallen sharply , as clothing sales pulled back the rising cost of living .
the consumer prices index fell to 1.6 % , a bigger drop than expected , with food prices also falling .
the office for national statistics found that clothing prices tumbled by 5.9 % month-on-month in july , as high street shops belatedly got their summer sales under way .
firms also reported that the cost of raw materials fell .
the government parties have argued that the recent drop in inflation shows that their policies are paying off .
the opposition labour party , though , said the weak wage growth ( just 0.6 % at present , or -0.2 % including bonuses ) means real pay is still falling .
full political reaction here .
martin beck , senior economic adviser to the ey item club , predicts that inflation will remain below the 2 % target for several months : the inflation environment remains benign .
after their iraq-related rally , oil prices have dropped sharply over the past month , with brent dropping below $ 100 a barrel yesterday for the first time in fifteen months .
and though the pound has weakened a little of late , it remains much higher than earlier in the year , which is helping to subdue import prices .
furthermore , today 's data suggest that - if anything - the pressures coming along the supply chain are disinflationary .
this all adds up to inflation remaining close to 1½ % over the second half of the year . ''
the game of predicting when the bank of england might raise interest rates took another spin , with economists explained that the fall in inflation makes a pre-christmas hike less likely .

here 's our news story : uk inflation fall to 1.6 % lessens likelihood of interest rate rise echoing that theory , the pound tumbled on the news , shedding almost a whole cent against the us dollar to a four-month low $ 1.6633 .

andy scott , spokesperson for fx advisory services at foreign currency specialists , hifx , explains : despite the economy growing at its fastest pace in several years and unemployment falling to its lowest level since the end of 2008 , employees are receiving wage increases below the current rate of inflation , resulting in a squeeze on annual earnings in real terms .

this indicates that there may indeed be additional slack in the labour market that needs to be used up in order for pay to keep up with inflation and gives the boe scope to continue to keep rates on hold .
another factor that 's probably winning the argument against raising rates too soon is that some of the world 's major economies either contracted or saw minimal growth in the last quarter .
this could weigh somewhat on the uk economy in the coming months , particularly with such a gloomy in the eurozone . ''
the retail price index , the wider measure of inflation , dropped slightly to 2.5 % in july .
that means that rail fares in england and wales are likely to rise by 3.5 % on average , and up to 5.5 % in some cases , in 2015 .
the chancellor , though , could yet cap rises at a lower rate the ons also reported that uk house prices hit a new record high in june , although the pace of growth moderated .

documents.title: larry elliott : uk inflation figures - say goodbye to your pay rise
text: 2014 was meant to be the year when real uk wages started growing , and interest rates rose .
but it 's not working out that way .
our economics editor , larry elliott , writes : even with july 's drop in inflation [ to 1.6 % ] , prices are still rising faster than earnings , which are going up at an annual rate of 0.6 % .
at the start of the year there was a lot of talk about how 2014 was going to be the year of the pay rise .
that now looks unlikely .
living standards will carry on falling deep into the autumn even if wages do start to up .
some city analysts think 2014 will also be the year of the interest rate rise .
that , too , is starting to look questionable given not just the weakness of cpi inflation but also the lack of any real price pressure in the pipeline .

the producer prices index , a guide to the costs paid by manufacturers and the price of goods leaving factory gates , shows that the drop in fuel and raw material costs together with tight control of pay is allowing firms to cut tariff prices .

an interest rate rise by the end of the year - november being the likeliest date - should not be ruled out , but it will be on the basis of what the bank of england 's monetary policy committee thinks is going to happen to inflation rather than what is actually happening .
more here : uk inflation figures - say goodbye to your pay rise
ey item club ( @ ey itemclub ) little immediate pressure on the mpc to raise rates after today 's # inflation figures .
mpc minutes tomorrow should confirm no 2014 rate hike

documents.title: the political reaction
text: today 's inflation figures have been grasped by both sides of the political spectrum .
the treasury claims that today 's fall in the consumer prices index , from 1.9 % to 1.6 % , is a sign that its policies are bearing fruit .
a spokesperson said : the government 's long term economic plan is working , with today marking the 7th consecutive month that inflation has been below the bank of england 's two per cent target .

but the effects of the great recession are still being felt and so we have taken continued action to help with the cost of living , including cutting income tax , freezing fuel duty and reducing the costs of childcare .

the job is not yet done so the government will go on making the realistic assessment of what needs to be done to deliver a brighter economic future '' liberal democrat chief secretary to the treasury , danny alexander , told sky news : the fact that inflation has been below the bank of england target for seven consecutive months shows that subdued inflation is now becoming the norm as the economy recovers .
eliminating the deficit fairly , and repairing the uk economy remains central to the role of liberal democrats in government .
these encouraging inflation numbers should give businesses the confidence they need to deliver the investment required to boost productivity .
rising productivity is the only route to sustainable increases in living standards . ''
the opposition labour party , meanwhile , points out that real incomes are still shrinking .
cathy jamieson mp , shadow treasury minister , says : while this fall in the rate of inflation is welcome , the squeeze on working people continues .
the latest figures show regular pay rising by just 0.6 per cent - less than half the rate of inflation announced today .
wages after inflation have now fallen by over £ 1,600 a year under this government .
labour 's economic plan will deal with the cost-of-living crisis , make britain better off and earn our way to higher living standards for all , not just a few . ''

documents.title: patrick collinson : chancellor could block inflation-busting fare increases
text: our money editor patrick collinson has hit the phones , and confirms that rail fare rises in 2014 could be lower than the 3.5 % that is widely expected .

as flagged up in my last post , it 's all down to george osborne over to patrick : this morning virtually every story on rail fares is assuming that prices for 'regulated ' fares will rise by 3.5 % from next year , using the formula of july 's rpi figure plus 1 % .
but there is absolutely no guarantee that will be the outcome .
in the autumn statement last year , the chancellor cancelled the rpi+1 % increase scheduled for january 2014 , replacing it with just a straightforward rpi increase .
what will happen in january 2015 ?
we know that the rpi figure will be used - but whether it will be +1 % or zero , or something else , is for now speculative .
this morning , a department for transport spokesman said : no decisions on fare rises for 2015 have yet been taken .
we understand people 's concerns about the cost of travel and the impact this has on family budgets .
that is why for 2014 we reduced average fare rises to rpi plus 0 % for the first time in a decade . ''
the reality is that the dft do not know precisely when a decision will be taken on the level of increases for 2015 , as it is ultimately a treasury decision .

in this year 's pre-election autumn statement , the chancellor could rule out inflation-plus increases , switch to the cpi measure used for welfare benefits , or even revert to the formula used in the years immediately after rail privatisation , when fares went up by rpi minus 1 % .
that would be a popular move , especially with britons heading to the polling booths in may 2015 george osborne .
winning/reuters
one point to flag up george osborne could offer britain 's rail travellers a reprieve from these hefty price rises in 2015 .
last autumn , the chancellor capped average regulated fare increases at rpi , rather than rpi + 1 % ( up to rpi +3 for some fares ) .
potentially , osborne could extend this freeze for another year chris choi ( @ chrisitv ) rail fares - wide speculation bordering on expectation that chancellor will reduce rises in autumn statement
we 're collecting expert reaction to today 's inflation data here : uk inflation - what the economists say
food prices fell a little between july and june , led by bread & cereals and sugar , jam , syrups , chocolate & confectionery .
that 's due to the ongoing price wars between major supermarkets , as established chains try to battle aldi and lidl .

mark billige , managing partner at pricing experts simon-kucher & partners , explains : whilst lower grocery prices are good news for consumers , they will be putting the margins of supermarkets and their suppliers under enormous pressure with a knock on effect on share prices .
we expect this trend to continue as the discounters continue increasing their market share . ''

alasdair cavalla , economist at the cebr , agrees that uk interest rates are unlikely to rise this year : a long stretch of below-target inflation increases the likelihood that the bank of england will raise interest rates in early 2015 rather than this year .
spare capacity , which is the bank 's stated guiding factor in its decision , is remaining higher for longer than expected .

cavalla points out that price growth is weak across the global economy : the eurozone has been falling ever closer to deflation , while the european central bank is facing strong bundesbank opposition to any monetary loosening measures .
us inflation data come out later today , but at just 2.1 % on the latest reading and expected to be at 2.0 % today , the rate is already below the long-term average .
in addition , a strong pound means that the uk economy finds imported goods even cheaper .
therefore , recent signals suggest the bank seems likely to wait until next year before raising the base rate .
bloomberg news ( @ bloombergnews ) pound drops to four-month low versus dollar as slowing inflation damps rate increase speculation

documents.title: uk inflation - reaction starts here
text: the bank of england a good excuse to keep its hands off the interest rate-raising lever until the new year , says jake trask , corporate dealer at ukforex .
with dovish comments from boe governor mark carney last week , this fall in inflation will provide the mpc with even more reason to hold out for q1 2015 before tightening monetary policy .
we may learn more tomorrow about the intended timeframe for a rate hike when the minutes of the latest mpc meeting are released . ''

here 's transport correspondent gwyn topham on the implications of today 's inflation data for rail passengers : rail fares will rise by an average of 3.5 % in january with some fares rising by up to 5.5 % , adding hundreds of pounds to the cost of season tickets .

labour and transport campaigners are stepping up their challenge to the railway system , with protests taking place at stations across the country as the extent of planned fare rises for 2015 is revealed .

campaigners have demanded action to tackle above-inflation fare increases , pointing out that ticket prices are rising nearly four times faster than wages and average fares will have risen 25 % under the coalition government .
regulated train fares are pegged to july 's retail price inflation figure of 2.5 % and capped at rpi+1 % - although train operators may raise fares on some routes by an extra 2 % .
the flex rule means some fares could rise by 5.5 % - and could add more than £ 300 to the cost of annual season tickets on the most expensive commuter routes .
cumulatively , prices will have gone up almost 25 % during the current parliament , while average wages have risen by 6.9 % .
according to the campaign for better transport commuters are spending up to a fifth of their income on season tickets .

more here : rail fares to rise by average of 3.5 % in january i believe , though , that scottish fares will rise by just 2.5 % - control of rail north of the border has been devolved to the scottish government .
britain 's double-digit house price inflation ( see last entry ) is a blow to those hoping to get into the housing ladder .

campbell robb , the chief executive of housing charity shelter , has urged the government to do more : today 's house price hike is yet another blow for people across the country desperate to put down roots and create a stable home .
no matter how hard people work or save , millions are being priced out of a home of their own , caught in the 'rent trap ' and constantly moving from one expensive property to the next .
the only solution is for politicians to roll up their sleeves and build the affordable homes we so desperately need .

from a new generation of part rent part buy homes , to encouraging smaller builders back into the market , there are ways to fix this country 's housing crisis.if we do n't see radical action soon , more and more people will be left without a hope of ever building a stable future in a home of their own . ''
we also have data showing that uk house price growth slowed a little at the start of the summer .
the average house price rose by 10.2 % in the 12 months to june , according to the ons .
that 's down from 10.4 % in the year to may .
it says : house price annual inflation was 10.7 % in england , 3.5 % in wales , 6.0 % in scotland and 4.9 % in northern ireland .
house prices are increasing strongly across most parts of the uk , with prices in london again showing the highest growth .
average prices in the capital have surged by 19.3 % over the last 12 months , and are now a staggering 35.6 % higher than the pre-financial crisis peak in january 2008 .
but more recent data has suggested that sellers in london are now cutting prices ; a sign the market may be cooling off

documents.title: read the report yourself
text: the inflation data is online here .
there are also signs that british firms face less inflationary pressure .
producer input prices ( basically , what firms pay for raw materials ) dropped 1.6 % month-on-month in july , and are a chunky 7.3 % lower than a year ago .
output prices ( what they charge for their goods ) fell slightly too .
david smith ( @ dsmitheconomics ) cpi inflation fall mainly clothing prices .
but pipeline pressures also weak - output prices down 0.1 % past year , input prices down 7.3 % .
the 5.7 % drop in clothing prices last month came from a wide range of men 's , women 's and children 's outerwear , for example trousers , coats and jumpers '' , the ons adds .

the chances of the bank of england raising interest rates in 2014 have fallen , flags up jeremy cook of currency firm world first : world first ( @ world first ) ois implied probability of a bank of england rate hike by christmas 2014 sits at 23.0 % post-cpi .
was 24.1 % yesterday

documents.title: uk inflation , the details
text: so , why the big drop in inflation last month ?
the office for national statistics says that the biggest single factor driving cpi down to 1.6 % was clothing prices , which tumbled by 5.7 % between june and july .
that suggests that summer clothing sales kicked off in earnest in july , after being delayed from june .
world first ( @ world first ) apparel sales that were delayed in june have hit cpi in july other large downward effects came from the alcohol , financial services and food & non-alcoholic drinks .
the ons explains : alcohol & tobacco prices , overall , fell by 0.7 % between june and july this year but rose by 0.6 % a year ago .
the downward effect came from a range of alcohol products , principally spirits and wine .
for both groups , prices fell this year but rose a year ago .
but transport costs rose , by 1.3 % between june and july .
contributions to the change in the cpi 12-month rate : july 2014 .
photograph : /ons
chris choi ( @ chrisitv ) train fare latest - 3.5 % will be average increase

documents.title: pound falls after uk inflation rate slows
text: the pound has taken a tumble as city traders react to the larger-than-expected fall in inflation last month .
it 's down 0.5 % , or 0.8 of a cent , at $ 1.665 , as the guessing game of when the bank of england will raise interest rates takes another twist .
ben wright ( @ benwright ) sterling takes a tumble after uk consumer price index shows inflation fell to 1.6 % in july from 1.9 % in june
here 's some instant reaction to the news that the headline uk inflation rate fell by more than expected in july : duncan weldon ( @ duncanweldon ) cpi falls from 1.9 % to 1.6 % .
consensus was 1.8 % - that 's a big drop and makes a rate rise less likely in near term .
james cadman ( @ sawanoya ) uk inflation falls to 1.6 % - wow !
a real deflation headache for # carney now .
rate rise cancelled .
# turningjapanese timesbusiness ( @ timesbusiness ) inflation has been below the bank of england 's target of 2 per cent every month in 2014 so far .

documents.title: rpi dips to 2.5 % - rail fares will be affected
text: the retail prices index , a broader measure of inflation , has also fallen , to 2.5 % in july .
that means average rail fares will rise by 3.5 % next year , under the government 's rpi +1 % formula .
but rail operators are allowed to raise some fares by as much as rpi +3 % , meaning some unlucky commuters face paying 5.5 % extra in 2015 .

documents.title: uk inflation falls to 1.6 % in july
text: breaking : the uk consumer prices index has tumbled to 1.6 % in july , a sharp fall on june 's 1.9 % .
that should bring some relief to households , and also takes inflation further away from the bank of england 's target of 2 % inflation .
but prices are still rising almost three times faster than wages - average earnings in the uk rose by just 0.6 % in the april-june quarter , according to the latest data .
lots more detail and reaction to follow
the pound just fell against the us dollar , down 0.3 of a cent at $ 1.6694 .
does that mean someone is anticipating a weak inflation reading in a few minutes time ?
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) gbp heading lower against both eur and usd ahead of the numbers which is mildly sus we will see

documents.title: uk inflation , a preamble
text: nearly time for the uk inflation data for july .
as flagged up earlier , economists expect the uk consumer prices index to have fallen a little , to 1.8 % from 1.9 % in june .
britain currently has the highest inflation rate in europe , with several members of the eurozone experiencing falling prices .
alper üçok ( @ alperucok ) annual inflation rates of eu members , from highest u.k. ( 1.9 % ) to lowest bulgaria ( -1 % )

documents.title: european shares rise again
text: european stock markets are showing small gains across the board , as hopes of easing geopolitical tensions cheer the city .
the ftse 100 has gained 0.5 % , or 33 points , to 6775 , despite bhp billiton ( -3.5 % ) dragging down the index as its demerger plans sink in .
germany 's dax has gained 1 % , on hopes that russia and ukraine may reach an agreement to end the long-running , deadly clashes on their borders .
the french cac is up 0.44 % .
the footsie being led by housebuilder barratt developments - which may be benefitting from strong results from rival persimmon this morning .
biggest risers on the ftse 100 this morning .
reuters persimmon , which builds homes outside the m25 , reported a 57 % jump in profits for the first half of 2014 .

the firm said the ongoing improvement in the uk 's economic performance '' was helping the sector , and claimed there was little sign '' of fatigue , despite recent signs that mortgage lending may be cooling off .
full story here .
guardian business ( @ businessdesk ) persimmon reports 57 % profit rise amid housebuilding recovery
rumours of a pact between the bank of england and the uk treasury to resist raising interest rates until after next may 's general election refuse to go away .
city am reports that the treasury committee will ask governor mark carney about his relationship with george osborne , after two mps raised concerns over the closeness of their relationship .
the boe and the treasury have tried to rubbish talk of a secret pact .

but as committee member mark garniere explained , this speculation could be damaging : the bank of england has to act independently , otherwise the whole thing becomes farcical - you get back to the worst case scenario where the chancellor is deciding rates covertly the treasury committee is very cognisant of this kind of risk . ''
timesbusiness ( @ timesbusiness ) city a.m.reporting that carney will be quizzed by mps over claims he had pact with osborne to keep rates low .
overnight , a former trader at dutch bank rabobank became the first britain to plead guilty to charges over the libor scandal .
paul robson had been accused of taking part in a scheme to manipulate the yen libor rate '' - a benchmark rate at which banks would lend to each other .
the us justice department said robson had pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud and bank fraud .
leslie caldwell , who heads the justice department 's criminal division , said : the scope of the fraud was massive , but the scheme was simple .
by illegally influencing the libor rates , robson and his co-conspirators rigged the markets to ensure that their trades made money . ''
robson is the second rabobank trader to plead guilty following probes into the alleged manipulation of interest rate benchmarks .
more here : ex-rabobank trader second to plead guilty to libor rigging

documents.title: bhp billiton shares drop as demerger plan announced
text: shares in bhp billiton , the anglo-australian mining giant , have promptly dropped by 3 % in early trading after it announced plans to spin off its aluminium , coal , manganese , nickel and silver assets into a new company .
it 's a massive demerger - which appears to un much of the deal that created the group in 2001 .
jac nasser , bhp chairman , says the deal will provide investors with choice and unlock value in both companies . ''
catherine boyle ( @ cboylecnbc ) oh , that 's why bhp billiton release took so long .

they were making up a whole new company , imaginatively called newco catherine boyle ( @ cboylecnbc ) and the market does n't like it no matter what it 's called - bhp billiton worst performer ftse 100 this morning after spin-off announced
rail campaigners have already warned that fares are rising too fast , even before today 's inflation data is released .
the campaign for better transport argues that the retail prices index +1 % '' formula ( or rpi + 3 % for some fares ) needs to change , as some commuters could pay an extra £ 300 each next year .
spokesman martin abrams is n't impressed that some fares could rise by around 5.6 % ( depending on today 's data , of course !
) : with people 's wages stagnating , and in some cases falling , the expense of taking the train to work has become a huge part of living costs .

if the government does n't put an end to above-inflation fare increases quickly , ordinary commuters will be priced off the train and could be forced into agonising decisions such as moving house or quitting their jobs '' more here : labour and transport campaigners step up rail fares fight as prices rise again

documents.title: inflation data in focus
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world economy , business and the eurozone .
inflation is high on the agenda , with new surveys showing the cost of living in britain and america due out today .
the uk 's consumer prices index index is expected to fall a little , after spiking unexpectedly last month .
economists predict cpi will dip to 1.8 % in july , from 1.9 % , at 9.30am .
that would mean prices were running three times faster than average wages ( which rose just 0.6 % in the three months to june ) .
cue plenty more justifiable concern that the uk recovery has n't reached workers ' pockets .
today 's inflation data is particularly important for uk commuters , as the wider retail prices index will be used to calculate next year 's rail fare increases .
rpi is expected to be unchanged at 2.6 % .
rail operators are allowed to increase fares by an average of rpi + 1 % .
but under a flex '' rule , train companies can raise some fares by another 2 % above the average , as long as they make cuts elsewhere .
so some passengers could face an inflation-busting 5.6 % increase , even if the service is n't that much better the western concourse at king 's cross railway station in london .
masterton/alamy america 's july inflation data is due at 1.30pm bst ( 8.30am new york ) , and is also expected to show a slight drop .
that could reduce the pressure on the us federal reserve to start raising interest rates , as it comes to the end of its bond-buying stimulus programme .
cmc market 's michael hewson explains : in the afternoon session we also get the latest us cpi inflation numbers and they are expected to slip slightly from the 2.1 % in june to 2 % in july .
a similarly weak number would undermine the recent rise in the us dollar as markets bet that rates are likely to remain lower for longer .
in the corporate world , mining giant bhp billiton has just announced plans to spin off many of its operations into a new global metals and mining company '' .
more on that shortly .

sky news business ( @ skynewsbiz ) bhp billiton to create a new global metals & mining company by spinning off some of its aluminium , coal , manganese , nickel and silver assets stock markets are expected to continue where they stopped yesterday , rising on hopes that the ukraine crisis is easing .
last night , the us nasdaq index hit its highest closing level in 14 years ( a peak that was swiftly followed by the dot-com crash ) .

ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) markets await any further clarity on the russian aid convoy 's safe passage into eastern ukraine 1/2 ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) after ukraine/russia tensions ebbed lower yesterday on a series of negotiations held between the countries counterparties 2/2 and in the city , building firm persimmon has reported that demand in the housing market remains strong after a leap in profits .
i 'll be tracking the main developments through the day .

bulletin.text: Britain's consumer prices index fell sharply last month, pushing an early rate rise off the agenda again.
Latest: American housing starts bounce back.
UK inflation falls to 1.6%: a summary.
Rail fares to rise by average of 3.5% in 2015
unless George Osborne implements a cap.
